channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge orders the Trump administration to return a Guatemalan man to the U.S.
item.description: A federal judge ordered the Trump administration late Friday to facilitate the return of a Guatemalan man it deported to Mexico in spite of his fears of being harmed there.
item.content:encoded:
A federal judge ordered the Trump administration late Friday to facilitate the return of a Guatemalan man it deported to Mexico in spite of his fears of being harmed there.

(Image credit: Christian Chavez)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Defense Sec. Hegseth puts new limits on press access at the Pentagon
item.description: The Pentagon restrictions on media covering the military follow a series of moves by the Trump administration to curtail press access. The changes overhaul historic access for the press.
item.content:encoded:
The Pentagon restrictions on media covering the military follow a series of moves by the Trump administration to curtail press access. The changes overhaul historic access for the press.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: Kristin Wright

item.title: Billy Joel cancels tour dates after diagnosis. What to know about the brain condition
item.description: The singer canceled his summer tour dates and revealed he has a brain condition called normal pressure hydrocephalus. It's treatable but tricky to diagnose, doctors say.
item.content:encoded:
The singer canceled his summer tour dates and revealed he has a brain condition called normal pressure hydrocephalus. It's treatable but tricky to diagnose, doctors say.

(Image credit: Evan Agostini)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: Americans are warned as latest DMV phishing scam targets phones
item.description: Your state DMV probably won't text you about unpaid fees — but scammers will.
item.content:encoded:
Your state DMV probably won't text you about unpaid fees — but scammers will.

(Image credit: Mario Tama)
item.dc:creator: Alana Wise

item.title: By the numbers: A look at international students at Harvard and across the U.S.
item.description: The latest criticism from the Trump administration of Harvard University highlighted the number of international students entering the United States each year for higher education.
item.content:encoded:
The latest criticism from the Trump administration of Harvard University highlighted the number of international students entering the United States each year for higher education.

(Image credit: Sophie Park)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: A hike on Cerro San Cristobal with stunning views of the Chilean Andes
item.description: Cerro San Cristobal in the heart of Chile's capital offers stunning views of wildflowers, pine forests and the soaring Andes.
item.content:encoded:
Cerro San Cristobal in the heart of Chile's capital offers stunning views of wildflowers, pine forests and the soaring Andes.

(Image credit: Brian Mann)
item.dc:creator: Brian Mann

item.title: Justice Department cuts to public safety grants leave police and nonprofits scrambling
item.description: Hundreds of public safety grants cut, worth $500 million, funded initiatives like drug treatment and gun violence prevention programs.
item.content:encoded:
Hundreds of public safety grants cut, worth $500 million, funded initiatives like drug treatment and gun violence prevention programs.

(Image credit: Alex Brandon)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: Opinion: Cheers to a life well lived
item.description: Character actor George Wendt was known to a generation as Norm, the beleaguered, lovable everyman on the sitcom Cheers. He died this week at the age of 76.
item.content:encoded:
Character actor George Wendt was known to a generation as Norm, the beleaguered, lovable everyman on the sitcom Cheers. He died this week at the age of 76.

(Image credit: Wally Fong)
item.dc:creator: Scott Simon

item.title: Trump's debunked 'burial site' video reopens 'wounds,' says victim's son
item.description: Trump's misleading video of a 'burial site' for white South African farmers reopened 'new wounds,' victim's son tells NPR.
item.content:encoded:
Trump's misleading video of a 'burial site' for white South African farmers reopened 'new wounds,' victim's son tells NPR.

(Image credit: Bloomberg)
item.dc:creator: Kate Bartlett

item.title: This Memorial Day, NPR readers honor the ones they've lost
item.description: Memorial Day, observed on the last Monday in May, is a day to honor and mourn fallen military service members. NPR readers share stories of the loved ones they've lost.
item.content:encoded:
Memorial Day, observed on the last Monday in May, is a day to honor and mourn fallen military service members. NPR readers share stories of the loved ones they've lost.

(Image credit: dallasgolden)
item.dc:creator: Suzanne Nuyen
